com.cyc.session

Interface CycServerAddress

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Comparable, Serializable
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    CycServer

    public interface CycServerAddress
extends Comparable, Serializable
    Describes the address of a Cyc server. This class encapsulates a Cyc server's host name, base port, and offset ports. It is easily serializable via its toString() method to a string representation as host:port.

      • getHostName

      • getResolvedHostName

        String getResolvedHostName()
        Returns the resolved hostname of this address. If the hostname is a loopback address (e.g. 127.0.0.1 or localhost), it will be converted to a fully-qualified domain-name. Otherwise, it will return the specified hostname as per getHostName().

        Note that this value is not used by #hashCode() or #equals(Object). Equality is based off of the explicitly-specified values.

        Returns:
        String the resolved hostname.

        Returns:

      • isDefined

        boolean isDefined()
        Checks whether the CycServerAddress instance contains enough information to be useful (i.e., a plausible hostname and base port.)
        Returns:
        whether CycServerAddress is plausibly useful.

      • toResolvedAddressString

        String toResolvedAddressString()
        Returns a string representation of the server address using the resolved hostname, in the format host:port. In other words, this methods behaves like toString(), but retrieves the hostname via getResolvedHostName().
        Returns:
        a string representation of the server address, using the resolved hostname.

      • toString

        String toString()
        Returns a string representation of the server address in the format host:port.
        Overrides:
        toString in class Object
        Returns:
        a string representation of the server address.
